ctu_text: "}]}, {"type": "heading_three", "children": [{"text": "Types of Services: "}]}, {"type": "ol_list", "children": [{"type": "list_item", "children": [{"text": "Emergency Response and Rescue Services: OSC will provide rescue and referral services to the women affected by violence. For this, linkages will be developed with existing mechanisms such as National Health Mission (NHM), 108 services, and police (PCR Van) so that the woman affected by violence can either be rescued from the location and referred to the nearest 4 medical facilities (Public/ Private) or shelter home. "}]}, {"type": "list_item", "children": [{"text": "Medical assistance: Women affected by violence would be referred to the nearest hospital for medical aid/examination which would be undertaken as per the guidelines and protocols developed by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Provision of the ambulance (if required) is provided. "}]}, {"type": "list_item", "children": [{"text": "Police assistance: Facilitate/Assist in filing First Information Report (FIR/NCR)is provided.

ctu_text:
Women affected by violence along with their children (girls of all ages and boys up to 8 years of age) can avail themselves of a temporary shelter at the OSC for a maximum period of 5 days. The admissibility of any woman to the temporary shelter would be at the discretion of the Centre Administrator 1. Video Conferencing Facility: Video Conferencing facility is provided under the scheme to facilitate online police and court proceedings.
", "briefDescription": "One-Stop Centres (OSCs) is a scheme by the Ministry of Women and Child Development intended to provide an integrated range of services to women affected by violence, in private and public spaces.
